Package entities

Class Spectator

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Spectator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Spectator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Implementation of a Spectator which will be watching an horse race and betting on it. This entity, belonging to the entities package, must coordinate its actions throughout several shared memory regions, while interacting with the Broker (which controlls its bets) and with the HorseJockey (in which each Spectator will bet).
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes
    See Also:
    Broker, HorseJockey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int bet
      Amount of money prepared to be launched over a bet.
      private int horse
      Identification of the horse on which a bet will be made.
      private int identification
      Proper Spectator numerical identification.
      private int money
      Current amount of this Spectator's money to spend on new bets.
      private int raceNumber
      The identification of the race which the Spectators want to bet and watch.
      private SpectatorState state
      A representation of the Spectator's state given by the SpectatorState enumeration.
      private boolean tired
      Level of fatigue of this Spectator.

      Creates a Spectator with an identification and a given amount of money.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spectator

        public Spectator​(int identification,
                 int money)
        Creates a Spectator with an identification and a given amount of money.
        Parameters:
        identification - number which identifies this Spectator.
        money - amount of money given to this Spectator.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run​()
        Definition of the Spectator's lifecycle. In a technical perspective this is reasoned by a thread definition function which resumes all the specifications of a Spectator, since its displacement from the BettingCentre, to the Paddock, passing by the Stable.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getSpectatorState

        public SpectatorState getSpectatorState​()
        Returns the Spectator state representation given by the SpectatorState enumeration.
        Returns:
        the current spectator SpectatorState.
        See Also:
        SpectatorState

      • setSpectatorState

        public void setSpectatorState​(SpectatorState state)
        Sets the Spectator's state, from the possible available SpectatorState enumeration.
        Parameters:
        state - Enumeration value represented by SpectatorState

      • getIdentification

        public int getIdentification​()
        Returns the Spectator numerical identification between all the others Spectators.
        Returns:
        a numerical identification represented as an integer.

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney​()
        Returns the amount of current money that this Spectator has available for new bets.
        Returns:
        the current amount of money, as an integer.
